title: ICE when using serde derives with an invalid inner doc comment

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I'm hitting an ICE when using serde derives with an invalid inner doc comment. This occurs on the playground on both stable and nightly. ### Code ```Rust use serde::Serialize; //! Pc #[derive(Serialize)] pub struct Pc; ``` ### Meta This is the version on my machine: `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.53.0 (53cb7b09b 2021-06-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: 53cb7b09b00cbea8754ffb78e7e3cb521cb8af4b commit-date: 2021-06-17 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.53.0 LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground) error[E0753]: expected outer doc comment --> src/lib.rs:4:1 | 4 | //! Pc | ^^^^^^ | = note: inner doc comments like this (starting with `//!` or `/*!`) can only appear before items thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Failed to find trailing delimited group in: [(Token(Token { kind: Ident("pub", false), span: src/lib.rs:6:1: 6:4 (#0) }), Alone), (Token(Token { kind: Ident("struct", false), span: src/lib.rs:6:5: 6:11 (#0) }), Alone), (Token(Token { kind: Ident("Pc", false), span: src/lib.rs:6:12: 6:14 (#0) }), Joint), (Token(Token { kind: Semi, span: src/lib.rs:6:14: 6:15 (#0) }), Alone)]', compiler/rustc_ast/src/tokenstream.rs:276:25 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.55.0-nightly (868c702d0 2021-06-30) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0753`. error: could not compile `playground` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt 2: core::ops::function::impls:: for &mut F>::call_once 3: as core::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator>::next 4: as alloc::vec::spec_from_iter::SpecFromIter>::from_iter 5: rustc_ast::tokenstream::AttrAnnotatedTokenStream::to_tokenstream 6: rustc_parse::prepend_attrs 7: rustc_parse::nt_to_tokenstream 8: ::expand 9: rustc_expand::expand::MacroExpander::fully_expand_fragment 10: rustc_expand::expand::MacroExpander::expand_crate 11: rustc_session::utils::::time 12: rustc_interface::passes::configure_and_expand_inner 13: rustc_interface::passes::configure_and_expand::{{closure}} 14: rustc_data_structures::box_region::PinnedGenerator::new 15: rustc_interface::passes::configure_and_expand 16: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::expansion 17: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 18: rustc_span::with_source_map 19: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 20: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set ```
